sentences.sContent: A lamp hung over the table.
sentences.sCn: 一盏灯悬挂在桌子上方。

sentences.sContent: She leaned over the desk to answer the phone.
sentences.sCn: 她身子探过桌面接电话。

sentences.sContent: The sign over the door said ‘Mind your head’.
sentences.sCn: 门上方的警示牌写着“小心碰头”。

sentences.sContent: We watched a helicopter flying low over the harbour.
sentences.sCn: 我们看着一架直升机在港口低空飞行。

sentences.sContent: ...The company's self-driving cars have done well over a million miles across various states in the US...
...The method for making beer has changed over time...

...finds that the best way to ensure employees are “engaged” is to give them more control over where and how they do their work―which may mean liberating them from having to do everything in collaboration with others...
...Viewing the past in high definition can make it very difficult to get over pain and regret...
...survey respondents disagree over whether this generation will follow in their parents，footsteps...
...Internet providers arouse customers’ anger over bandwidth speed and cost...
...The other cut down gradually over the course of two weeks...
...That way they socialize over history outside the class...
...and other assignments over the course of a term better enhance learning and retention...

招待某人在家吃饭 (或饮酒等)

煎半熟蛋；煎两面；结束容易

words.tran: 过于老化；商品过剩；人工时效过度

trans.tranOther: above or higher than something, without touching it
